item.title: "Sar Mein Kuch Hai?": Rohit Sharma Fumes At India Star Over Bizarre Delivery In Gabba Test. Watch | Cricket News - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Loses Cool At India Star, Rant Goes Viral: "Sar Mein Kuch Hai?"

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: NDTV

India captain Rohit Sharma was visibly frustrated during the 3rd Test against Australia in Brisbane, leading to a viral reaction caught on the stump mic.

  • Rohit Sharma yelled at pacer Akash Deep after a poor delivery during Australia's innings.
  • His comment, "Abbe sar mein kuch hai? (Is there anything in your brain?)", sparked laughter in the commentary box.
  • The incident occurred during a challenging moment for India, who were struggling at 51/4 when rain interrupted play.
  • Australia had posted 445 runs, with Rohit yet to score as he navigated a challenging batting situation.
“Rohit Sharma & Stump-mic Gold - the story continues... #AUSvINDOnStar” — Star Sports (@StarSportsIndia) December 16, 2024

In conclusion, Rohit Sharma's candid moment highlighted the pressures faced by teams in high-stakes matches and quickly became a talking point among fans and commentators alike.

item.title: India's top order fails again, Australia in box seat despite rain on Day 3 of Gabba Test - The Times of India
item.description:
India's Top Order Fails Again, Australia in Box Seat Despite Rain on Day 3 of Gabba Test

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: Times of India

Australia bowled out for 445, with Jasprit Bumrah taking six wickets. India struggled at 51 for 4 by day’s end with rain impacting play.

  • Australia added only 40 runs to their overnight total before being bowled out.
  • Jasprit Bumrah achieved a six-wicket haul, with figures of 6 for 76.
  • India’s top order collapsed with key players dismissed early by Australian bowlers.
  • Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood proved particularly effective against India’s batting lineup.
  • Weather interruptions limited play time, affecting both teams' performances.
“We as a team are going through transition,” said Jasprit Bumrah.

Despite the rain, India may see a draw as their best hope, while Australia is eager to force a follow-on.

BBL 2024-2025: Match 2 Prediction - SIX vs REN

Publication Date: December 15, 2024 Source: CricTracker

The Big Bash League (BBL) 2024-25 sees Sydney Sixers facing off against Melbourne Renegades in the second match of the tournament. Both teams are eager to establish a strong start for the season.

  • Match will take place at Sydney Cricket Ground on December 16, 2024, at 1:45 PM IST.
  • Sydney Sixers finished second last season, while Melbourne Renegades had a poor performance, finishing seventh.
  • The pitch at Sydney Cricket Ground favors batters, suggesting a high-scoring match.
“Sydney Sixers to win the match”

This prediction indicates Sydney Sixers are expected to continue their momentum from last season against Melbourne Renegades.

item.title: Vinod Kambli vs MS Dhoni: How much PENSION these ex-cricketers get from BCCI - India.com
item.description:
Vinod Kambli vs MS Dhoni: How much PENSION these ex-cricketers get from BCCI

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: India.com

The article discusses the pension amounts received by former Indian cricketers Vinod Kambli and MS Dhoni, highlighting the differences based on their cricketing careers.

  • Vinod Kambli receives a pension of Rs 30,000 for playing less than 25 Tests.
  • MS Dhoni receives a higher pension of Rs 70,000 for playing over 90 Tests.
  • Kambli's past net worth was Rs 12 to 13 crore, but he is currently reliant on his pension.
  • Dhoni has a net worth exceeding Rs 1000 crore and does not depend solely on his BCCI pension.
  • The article compares their cricketing statistics and financial statuses post-retirement.
"Former India captain MS Dhoni doesn't rely on BCCI pension. He has net worth of over Rs 1,000 crore with interests in various business."

This comparison illustrates the financial disparities faced by retired cricketers based on their international cricket careers.

item.title: 'Rohit Sharma, Gambhir not on same page': Adelaide, Brisbane show sparks speculations of divide in India dressing room - Hindustan Times
item.description:
‘Rohit Sharma, Gambhir not on same page’: Adelaide, Brisbane show sparks speculations of divide in India dressing room

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses the performance of the Indian cricket team in recent matches, highlighting a possible rift between captain Rohit Sharma and head coach Gautam Gambhir following disappointing results against Australia.

  • India lost by 10 wickets in the Adelaide Test and continued poor performance in Brisbane.
  • Speculation from Basit Ali suggests a divide in the team, stating that Sharma and Gambhir might not be aligned in their strategies.
  • Jasprit Bumrah was noted as a standout performer, yet the team struggled overall.
  • Questions were raised about team selection and tactics, particularly relating to bowling choices against Australia’s left-handers.
“Rohit Sharma and Gautam Gambhir are not on the same page...it's Bumrah vs Australia” - Basit Ali.

The ongoing performance issues raise concerns about team cohesion and strategy, suggesting that leadership alignment may be key to improving results.

item.title: Moment of the Weekend: Amad for Amorim - Manchester derby lit up by Diallo's magical strike - ESPN India
item.description:
Amad Diallo Shines in Manchester Derby with Stunning Goal

Date: Dec 16, 2024, Source: ESPN

Amad Diallo's exceptional performance led Manchester United to a thrilling victory against Manchester City, highlighted by a magical strike that secured the win in the Manchester derby.

  • Diallo displayed his relentless energy and skill throughout the match.
  • He won a penalty that was converted by Bruno Fernandes to equalize the game.
  • In the dying moments, Diallo scored the winning goal with a remarkable finish.
  • His captain, Fernandes, praised Diallo for his vital contributions.
“He showed again today he is always alive... He has been brilliant. When he is like this he is unstoppable.” - Bruno Fernandes

This performance marks a significant moment in Diallo's career as he cements his place in the starting lineup under new coach Ruben Amorim.

item.title: 'Sar mein kuch hai?':Rohit Sharma loses cool, yells at Akash Deep as Australia frustrate India in Brisbane Test - Hindustan Times
item.description:
'Sar mein kuch hai?': Rohit Sharma Loses Cool During Frustrating Brisbane Test

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The third Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series saw a frustrating day for both teams due to rain delays. India's captain Rohit Sharma expressed his frustration at teammate Akash Deep for a bowling error, which became a viral moment on social media.

  • The match faced multiple rain delays affecting both teams.
  • Rohit Sharma was visibly frustrated with Akash Deep during the match.
  • India was reduced to 4 for 48 runs by Australia's bowlers.
  • India aims to avoid the follow-on as rain continues to hinder play.
“Abbe sar mein kuch hai? (Is there anything in your brain?)” - Rohit Sharma

The ongoing challenges in the match suggest India will need to bat effectively to secure a draw, especially with further rain forecasted.

Continuing rain has disrupted play in the ongoing 3rd Test match between India and Australia, with uncertainty surrounding tomorrow's weather forecast.

  • The match on day 3 has seen multiple interruptions due to rain.
  • Officials are optimistic about resuming play depending on the weather.

“We are monitoring the situation closely and hope for a timely return to play.”

The anticipation for tomorrow hinges on weather conditions, which will ultimately decide if play can resume.

item.title: Vinod Kambli lives in house worth Rs 80000000, Sachin Tendulkar helped him financially, does he still have home loan... - India.com
item.description:
Vinod Kambli lives in house worth Rs 80000000, Sachin Tendulkar helped him financially, does he still have home loan...

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: India.com

In this article, we explore the financial difficulties faced by former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli and the assistance provided by his childhood friend and cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar.

  • Vinod Kambli resides in a house worth approximately Rs 80 million.
  • Sachin Tendulkar has financially supported Kambli, including covering medical expenses.
  • Kambli has taken a home loan of Rs 5.5 million but missed several installments.
  • His only current income is his pension of Rs 30,000 from BCCI.
  • Kambli has expressed gratitude for the support of his wife, Andrea Hewitt.
“Vinod Kambli is currently surviving on a pension of Rs 30,000.”

Despite the challenges, Kambli remains hopeful for assistance from former cricket legends for his recovery and financial stability.

item.title: Ravi Shastri shocked as Yashasvi Jaiswal ridiculed by Vaughan for dismissal: ‘In practice it was perfect’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ravi Shastri Shocked as Yashasvi Jaiswal Faces Criticism for Dismissal

Date: Dec 16, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Yashasvi Jaiswal faced criticism for his early dismissal in India's innings at the Gabba after a mis-hit shot led to a catch off Mitchell Starc. Former England captain Michael Vaughan mocked the talented youngster's inconsistency.

  • Yashasvi Jaiswal was out on the second ball of India's innings.
  • The dismissal was criticized as a 'soft' wicket given away cheaply.
  • Michael Vaughan commented on Jaiswal's practice versus performance disparity.
  • Ravi Shastri expressed disbelief at Jaiswal’s choice of shot at a crucial moment.
  • The Indian team struggled, being 39-3 after several disruptions due to rain.
“Five minutes before Jaiswal got out... in practice it’s perfect.” - Michael Vaughan

The criticism surrounding Jaiswal emphasizes the pressure young players face in international cricket, especially against formidable opponents like Australia.

item.title: How India Can Qualify For World Test Championship Final If Gabba Test vs Australia Is Washed Out - E.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
How India Can Qualify For World Test Championship Final If Gabba Test vs Australia Is Washed Out - Explained

Publication Date: December 14, 2024

Source: NDTV

The race for places in the World Test Championship final is heating up. Currently, four teams are in contention: South Africa, India, Australia, and Sri Lanka. The outcome of the ongoing series between India and Australia, particularly the possible washout at the Gabba, could impact India's chances of qualification.

  • If India wins the series 3-1, they will qualify for the WTC final without depending on others.
  • The game at the Gabba was abandoned due to weather conditions, and a possibility of a draw could affect the series outcome.
  • India's chances of qualifying depend on the results of their remaining matches and the performance of Sri Lanka against Australia.
If India draw the series 1-1, Sri Lanka must draw or beat Australia to keep India in the competition.

The result of the series will ultimately determine India's fate in the World Test Championship.

item.title: How Mitchell Starc got rid of Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill at Gabba - WATCH - The Times of India
item.description:
How Mitchell Starc got rid of Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill at Gabba - WATCH

Date: NEW DELHI Source: Times of India

Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood dismantled India's top order, leaving the team struggling on Day 3 of the third Test at the Gabba. Starc dismissed both Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill, contributing to India's woes.

  • Australia scored 445 runs in their first innings.
  • Mitchell Starc dismissed Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shubman Gill on the same day.
  • Jaiswal's average against left-arm pacers is notably poor at 17.33.
  • Jasprit Bumrah took 6 wickets for 76 runs for India.
  • The series is currently tied at 1-1.
"Jaiswal's struggles against left-arm pacers continue to haunt him, with six dismissals in nine Test innings."

The match remains tense, with the series finely balanced as each team aims for a crucial victory.

item.title: "Edged And Gone": Virat Kohli Repeats Same Mistakes, Triggers Epic Meme Fest - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Edged And Gone": Virat Kohli Repeats Same Mistakes, Triggers Epic Meme Fest

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Virat Kohli faced yet another disappointing dismissal during India’s tour of Australia, falling for just three runs as he chased an outside-off delivery from Josh Hazlewood.

  • Kohli continues to struggle with his form in Australia, often getting out to deliveries outside off stump.
  • This dismissal marks a continuation of his issues throughout the series.
  • Despite his poor run, fans have taken to social media to humorously critique his performances.
"Edged, caught behind the stumps, and gone" - cricket.com.au

In the innings, India faced a challenging situation at 22 for three, following a strong Australian first innings score of 445.

item.title: India vs Australia, 3rd Test Day 3 Live Updates: Rain Stops Play Again As Pant, Rahul Look To Rescue India - NDTV Sports
item.description:
IND vs AUS, 3rd Test Day 3 Live Score Updates

Date: December 16, 2024 Source: NDTV Sports

India's match against Australia has been significantly affected by rain. After losing key wickets, Rishabh Pant and KL Rahul have come together to stabilize the innings.

  • Australia set a strong total of 445 in their first innings.
  • Virat Kohli disappointed again, out for just 3 runs.
  • KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant are currently at the crease as India faces mounting pressure.
  • The match has been interrupted multiple times due to rain.
"This Test is turning out to be a disaster for both Team India and fans."

The ongoing match is crucial for both teams as they strive for dominance in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

item.title: IND vs AUS: 'Virat Kohli should learn from MS Dhoni and retire' - Indian run machine flops again - The Times of India
item.description:
IND vs AUS: 'Virat Kohli should learn from MS Dhoni and retire' - Indian run machine flops again

Date: Not Provided Source: Times of India

India's star batter Virat Kohli is under fire for his poor performance following another low score during the third Test against Australia at the Gabba, Brisbane.

  • Kohli was dismissed for only 3 runs after edging the ball to wicketkeeper Alex Carey.
  • This marks the latest in a series of disappointing performances, with scores of 5, 100*, 7, and 11 in the current series.
  • Fans are vocally criticizing his recent form, with some calling for his retirement.
  • Despite a century in the second Test, Kohli has struggled overall in the series.
Fans took to social media to express their frustration, urging the player to consider retirement.

In conclusion, Virat Kohli's recent performances have led to significant disappointment among fans, stirring debate about his future in international cricket.

item.title: Shreyas Iyer Creates History, Becomes First Player To... - Times Now
item.description:
Shreyas Iyer Creates History

Date: December 15, 2024 Source: Times Now

Shreyas Iyer made history by becoming the first captain to lead a team to victory in both the Indian Premier League (IPL) and the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) in the same year.

  • Shreyas Iyer created history.
  • Mumbai won the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.
  • Shreyas is likely to lead PBKS in IPL 2025.
“Shreyas Iyer wrote his name in the history books by becoming the first captain in history to win both the Indian Premier League (IPL) and Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy (SMAT) trophies in the same year.”

This remarkable achievement confirms Iyer's place in cricket history, highlighting his leadership skills and performance under pressure.

item.title: Virat Kohli blasted over 'poor, impatient' act as Sunil Gavaskar shows no mercy for reckless dismissal in Gabba Test - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli Criticized for Reckless Dismissal in Gabba Test

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Virat Kohli faced harsh criticism from former captain Sunil Gavaskar for his dismissal in the Gabba Test against Australia, highlighting his ongoing struggle with wide deliveries.

  • Virat Kohli got out cheaply chasing a wide delivery from Josh Hazlewood.
  • Sunil Gavaskar emphasized the need for Kohli to exhibit more patience after India's early wickets.
  • Kohli's recent performances have raised concerns about his batting consistency, with calls for him to learn from past greats like Sachin Tendulkar.
  • Current statistics show Kohli has fallen behind contemporaries in Test centuries since early 2021.
“If it was on the fourth stump I could understand...this was wide, on the seventh, eighth stump, you could say. There's no need to play that.” - Sunil Gavaskar

The scrutiny surrounding Kohli's dismissals continues, with increasing pressure on him to adapt and perform consistently in high-stakes matches.

item.title: Isa Guha Apologises Over 'Racist Remark' On Jasprit Bumrah, Ravi Shastri Reacts - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Isa Guha Apologises Over 'Racist Remark' On Jasprit Bumrah, Ravi Shastri Reacts

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: NDTV

The incident occurred during commentary of the third Test between India and Australia, where Isa Guha mentioned Jasprit Bumrah in a controversial manner. This led to a public backlash, prompting Guha to issue an apology on live television.

  • Isa Guha referred to Jasprit Bumrah as a 'primate' while praising his bowling skills.
  • She later clarified that her remark was meant to be a compliment, stating she admires Bumrah greatly.
  • Guha apologised for any offense caused, emphasizing her commitment to empathy and inclusivity.
  • Ravi Shastri praised Guha's decision to apologise publicly, calling it a brave move.
A very genuine apology from Isa Guha. — Dan News (@dannews)

Guha expressed hope that her comment did not overshadow the ongoing Test match and reiterated her lack of malice in the statement.

item.title: India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 3 Live Score: Rain returns as IND batters drive into AUS trap; Kohli, Gill, Jaiswal fall - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 3rd Test Day 3 Live Score: Rain forces players off 4th time shortly after start of second session

Publication Date: December 16, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Rain has interrupted the third day of the Test match between India and Australia multiple times, impacting the flow of play as both teams battle for supremacy in the series.

  • India was reduced to 22/3 at lunch, trailing by 423 runs.
  • Virat Kohli and Shubman Gill both fell early, with poor shot selection being a critical factor.
  • Australia scored a total of 445 runs, with Travis Head and Steve Smith dominating on Day 2.
  • Alex Carey was key to Australia's innings, securing a half-century efficiently.
  • Multiple rain delays have disrupted both innings, with players forced off the field repeatedly.
“One would say it is poor shot selection. You can say that they have bowled well and they have pitched it up but if you look at the three dismissals, none of them were great deliveries.” – Cheteshwar Pujara

As the match progresses, the focus falls on India's performance in batting to recover from a fragile position.

item.title: ‘I am deeply sorry’: Isa Guha issues apology for calling Jasprit Bumrah a ‘primate’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Isa Guha Apologizes for Calling Jasprit Bumrah a 'Primate'

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: Indian Express

Isa Guha has issued an apology after referring to Jasprit Bumrah as a 'primate' during commentary.

  • Guha made the comment while praising Bumrah after he took five wickets.
  • The term 'primate' raised concerns due to the historical context between India and Australia.
  • She apologized on-air, emphasizing her respect for Bumrah and commitment to inclusion.
  • Guha expressed her intention was to praise Bumrah, not to offend.
“I used a word that can be interpreted in a number of different ways... I am deeply sorry.”

Guha's apology highlights the importance of language in sports commentary, especially given past tensions between the teams.
